Class Primitive

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Primitive
All Implemented Interfaces:
Location
Direct Known Subclasses:
Sphere, Tripod
public abstract class Primitive
extends java.lang.Object
implements Location

This class is the parent for all shapes. It includes some general methods for calculations that shapes must do to be able to draw them selves.

Constructor Detail

Primitive

public Primitive(Vector3 pos,
                 java.awt.Color col)
Creates a new primitive object.
Parameters:
pos - The primitives location.
col - The primitives initial color.
Method Detail

frame

public abstract void frame()
Draws the current Primitive in a window defined by win as seen from the camera cam. Each Primitive subclass needs to define their own version of this method since it is a shape-unique method.

initFrame

public static void initFrame(Camera camera,
                             WinDesc win)
These are frame specific informatia that need to be configred. They only need to be done once per frame for the whole scene, as it initializes the software-internal graphics system.
Parameters:
camera - Tells all objects what camera to render from.
win - Information on the current viewport.

Returns:
The objects current position

rot

public void rot(double x,
                double y,
                double z)
Rotates the object around the origin. Serves absoulutely no purpose in the gravitation simulation, but allows freedom of implementation.

public void trans(double x,

drawCircle

protected void drawCircle(double x,
                          double y,
                          double r,
                          java.awt.Color col)
Draws a circle on the viewplane. The function automatically transforms to screen-cordinates.

drawLine

protected void drawLine(Vector3 p1,
                        Vector3 p2)
Draws a line on the viewplane. The function automatically transforms to screen-cordinates.

drawPoint

protected void drawPoint(Vector3 p)
Draws a point on the viewplane. The function automatically transforms to screen-cordinates.

doTri

protected void doTri(Vector3 p1,
                     Vector3 p2,
                     Vector3 p3,
                     double s)
Draws a filled triangle on the viewplane, scaling to screen-coordinates automatically. The function takes back-facing into account, and uses a flat-shading algorithm, which unfortunately seems to change the hue even if only the brightness should change. This is due to a malfunction in the getHSVcolor() function.
